pr_title: Boot into hardware setup menu on Vmware

timeline.bodyText: Minor style fix: missing space after the '='
timeline.author: nvazquez

timeline.bodyText: The null check was removed, can you include it inside this if clause?
timeline.author: nvazquez

replies.bodyText: null won't be equal to ApiConstants.BootType.UEFI so it is implied.
replies.author: DaanHoogland

timeline.bodyText: Minor improvement request: what about removing the boolean variable and init the string buffer empty, so at this point instead of asking for the boolean flag you could check if the generated string is not empty, in that case log it
timeline.author: nvazquez

replies.bodyText: actually the initial text would have to be added so the logic would replace teh guard boolean with a string concatenation. I prefer this.
replies.author: DaanHoogland

timeline.author: nvazquez

timeline.bodyText: We are swallowing the exception here, should we try to stop the process instead?
timeline.author: nvazquez

replies.bodyText: no, the rest of the reboot process can still proceed normally and it is an unlikely event that implies an error in Vsphere.
replies.author: DaanHoogland

replies.bodyText: ok, revisited this and yes it is a valid concern in view of the hard reset that follows in the calling method. I'll have to refactor this to handle a failure to set the parameter on the VM.
replies.author: DaanHoogland

replies.bodyText: I improved this flow @nvazquez can you have a look? I can not think of a way of testing this. Unless there is a way to disallow booting into setup from vsphere. (/me doing quick google now ;)
replies.author: DaanHoogland

replies.bodyText:
Looks good. I can think of a way to test this:
What about adding a config key to control the delay as described here? (bootDelay param) https://vdc-download.vmware.com/vmwb-repository/dcr-public/b50dcbbf-051d-4204-a3e7-e1b618c1e384/538cf2ec-b34f-4bae-a332-3820ef9e7773/vim.vm.BootOptions.html
Will need testing but as it expects a long value, sending a negative delay may cause VM config to throw an exception
replies.author: nvazquez

replies.bodyText: :) next feature, but good to keep in mind!
replies.author: DaanHoogland

timeline.author: nvazquez

timeline.bodyText: For readability can you change it to: enterSetup != null && hypervisor != Vmware?
timeline.author: nvazquez

replies.bodyText: would enterSetup != null && !HypervisorType.VMware.equals(vmInstance.getHypervisorType()) be acceptable as well?
replies.author: DaanHoogland

timeline.author: nvazquez

replies.bodyText: trying to clean it up enough to deal with the cyclic dependencies.
replies.author: DaanHoogland

timeline.bodyText: Just format stuff: these annotations have been moved to the same line as the method's firm all over the class
timeline.author: nvazquez

timeline.bodyText: @DaanHoogland Is hardware setup same as boot setup?
timeline.author: rhtyd

replies.bodyText: in hindsite this name should have been something like "bootIntoFirmware". many names have passed the catwalk. on resource level it is called enterHardwareSetup on API it is bootIntoSetup.
replies.author: DaanHoogland

timeline.message: add boolean flag boot into bios
trace value of param before and after job queue
pass parameter on start of existing VM
just retrieve param, not param of param
enable BIOS setup only on vmware
log and passthrough param on startVM
don't reboot if setup requested but not set
nested virtualisation flags available in unit tests and prod

timeline.bodyText: I don't like this message, missing capital "B" and in general I don't like it... can we reword it to  "...not supported for ...." or similar?
timeline.author: andrijapanicsb

replies.bodyText: ah, yes we can but a new re-word PR is needed.
replies.author: DaanHoogland
